experience.description: A.B. Candidate in Social Studies Weatherhead Center for International Affairs Undergraduate Associate. Committee on Ethnicity, Migration, and Rights 2020 Grant Recipient

experience.title: Intercollegiate Business Convention - Co-Chair
experience.description: Executive board member in charge of planning the largest undergraduate business conference in the world.

experience.title: Harvard Campus Associate
experience.description: Romulus Capital is a lead investor in early-stage Seed & Series A startups in B2B enterprise and commercialization of science across different verticals. We focus on company-building, rather than betting on companies. Rather than investing in dozens of startups, we go all-in on a few companies a year on capital, team recruitment, customer introductions, and GTM strategy. Our firm is unique combination of young and entrepreneurial, yet established with 3 funds with ~$200M AUM. We pride ourselves as a small, hungry team that brings the same level of grit and hustle as our founders.

experience.title: Intern
experience.description: I had sole responsibility for designing, building, and maintaining a database which identified potential deals. Using large downloads of market-wide data, I developed a ranking system, weighting relevant data points about each asset, fund, or fund manager. I also created a company-wide Geographic Information System which mapped the location of all of the firm's assets. These tasks required a high level of accuracy, judgement, and attention to detail. In addition, I met with software vendors, participated in investor meetings, and presented to senior management.

experience.title: Intern
experience.description: Conducted research and analysis of companies and sectors; specifically, analyzing and presenting on clients' competitive and strategic position within existing markets.

extracurriculars.title: Led the Center for International Affairs Undergraduate Associate
